title: Question 8
prompt: Choose the answer that is written correctly and shows the correct capitalization and punctuation.  Be sure the answer you choose is complete.
feedback:
The correct answer is “Upon entering the museum, Danny noticed the massive sculpture in the center of the room.” It correctly uses a comma after a modifying word or phrase that goes at the beginning of the sentence. “Upon entering the museum” is a prepositional phrase that tells when the action happens. Because it is at the beginning of the sentence, use a comma to show where the main clause begins.

The choice “Danny entered the museum noticed the massive sculpture in the center of the room” is missing the word “and” between “museum” and “noticed.”

The choice “Upon entering the room the massive sculpture was in the center of the room” implies that the sculpture entered the room! In this choice, “upon entering the room” is a dangling modifier.

The choice “Danny noticed the massive sculpture in the center, of the room upon entering the museum” has an unnecessary comma after the word “center.” No comma is needed before a prepositional phrase after the verb.
